summary: Elizabeth Brown Norris is an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978. These documents list her position, annual salary, and earnings for specific pay periods. The documents indicate her continued employment with the HSCA throughout the latter half of 1978.
significance: Elizabeth Brown Norris's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination. The payroll records confirm her role within the committee's staff, though the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents.
